page.title: 03SITE OF THURGARTON, NOTTS.
page.content: {Thurgarton}is a compact village of 400 people sited on the N.W. edge of the{Trent Valley}where a small stream has cut a subsequent valley through the steepish hillside from the lightly rolling land above. Although there has been some ribbon development on the road to{Bleasby}the up-market private estate consolidates the aforementioned compactness. The site of the village, in a small curve in the hillside ,and with its Beck tumbling through ,is very pleasing. No wonder the monks chose this spot to build their{Priory}which rivalled in size that of Southwell four miles away to the north. There is a beautiful view of the Dumble and Priory from the hillside to the south.On the main road in the village centre are two pubs,one a well known restaurant,and the little shop/P.O.
